rComments: Otte is a wonderful and engaging professor! He seems very enthusiastic about subject and material. He explains lectures clearly, and the class isn't too much work if you pay attention in class. He's witty, intelligent,and kinda sassy, which throws some people off when they are confused/ask questions.

Nice guy.  Really smart. Lectures are ok if you understand what he's saying. Doesn't really slow down. If you say you don't understand he'll just repeat the same explanation that didn't make sense the 1st time. Gives practice test similar to exams but TA's couldn't solve them. 80% Tests, 20% HW. If A on all tests, HW doesn't count against you

Professor Otte is the best professor I have had so far at ucsc. He is the archetypical professor. He assigns a minimal amount of homework and expects you to do most of the studying on your own. If you need help, go to office hours!  Professor Otte is very helpful and an amazing person to talk to in general.

Professor Otte is such a friendly teacher. He smiles all throughout his lectures and is very laid back and comfortable in front of the class. He also stops a lot, simply to ask if everyone is able to follow along. The class material is definitely a challenge to grasp, but he's very eager to answer questions and re-explain concepts.

I took Ric's Intermediate Logic and Faith and Reason classes this fall. SUCH AN AMAZING TEACHER! He is also a genius. Yeah, the material is super hard, and it takes a lot of work (which probably accounts for all the nay-saying on this website). But Dr. Otte is amazingly patient and helpful and obviously wants to facilitate learning. Take his class!

Only take a class from him if you have a high tolerance for pain. He makes horrible arguments and discounts anyone's opinion he disagrees with by introducing them as an atheist and providing various ad hominem attacks. Another tactic he uses is to say he doesn't understand something and rejects it on those grounds. Avoid at all costs.

One of my favorite professors.  Follow him if you are a philosophy major.  I did not take intro logic with him, and I do not know how he teaches that class.  I am taking Non-Classical Logic with him and he's very engaging and approachable.
awesome awesome awesome.  even i didn't go to class all the time and i loved going to class!  haha, that's not logical... DEDUCTIVE LOGIC TO SEE-DUCTIVE LOGIC!

The people that gave Otte a bad review obviously did not ever go to class.  Otte is a very good professor and the class is extremely easy IF you attend class.  All of his tests are based on the course material taught in class and NOT on the text.  However, this isn't a problem since he makes this crystal clear in the first class.

My fav. professor at UCSC - such a goober.  If you are logical as hell like he is you will follow him perfectly.  Barely consulting the book but attending every class attentively, I got easy As in intro and intermediate logic.

horrible teacher. Nice guy overall, but should not be teaching. He does not explain anything to people who do not understand and his exams have unfair extra credit assignments. Does not sepicfy how much anything in the class is worth and continues with new material even if you dont understand the old material.Don't take his classes!

intro to logic is a mistake, i took it my first quater as a freshman and hated it. Otte is a nice guy but assumes everyone understands when really everyone is clueless while he moves on with his lectures. if you take it, ask questions, and do problems in the book everyday. I took it pass/fail, passed but only cuz i had a baller TA, use ur TA's....

Otte is a very nice guy, pretty funny too (in a dorky way). This class might be very difficult for anyone who has no previous experience with logic. The information is not intuitive, but the book and your TA can be helpful if you put in the time. It is not easy to understand the material just by attending lecture alone, unless maybe you're a mathy.
great teacher, knows the material, very engaged
No Comments
A teacher who is really excited about his subject matter, and usually takes the time to explore tangents. I really enjoyed the class
Nature of Science is a horrible class. Very boring and repetitive. Its a total **** studying for those tests. I would strobgly NOT recommend this class (and im a good student)
No Comments
Kinda rambles on to much aboutsubject matter....repeats self to often.  Never talk to him in person.....looks at you in a very condesending manner.

Richard is a great prof.  He is so caring and helpful.  You can tell he really wants you to learn and be interested in what you are learning.  He is a very patient teacher and will gladly give you his time to help you in doing your best.

Richard is a great guy.  Really intelligent and eager to help everyone learn.  Also, he seems to really enjoy his profession which is a major bonus.  Plus, he's letting me sneak into his graduate logic class despite the fact that I'm not a graduate student...and that makes him a-okay in my book.
